SEARCH
Package neupaths.api

Class Activator

java.lang.Object
neupaths.api.Activator
Direct Known Subclasses:
EventActivator
public abstract class Activator extends Object
The base class for NeuPaths activator types. Activators consume and produce stimuli. Each activator advertises the stimuli it wants to receive on its receptors using subscriptions. An activator may send stimuli on its transmitters.

Specializations of this class must implement the evaluate() method and can optionally override the start() and stop() methods.

An activator evaluates when all of its receptors contain stimuli. The getStimulus(java.lang.String) method is used from within evaluate() to process the stimuli. Each time evaluate() is called, the stimuli on the Activator's receptors are consumed, whether or not they are used during evaluation.

Activators can be declared using their constituent parts or in a single expression. For example, the following are equivalent:

From constituent parts: 

     public class WorldHelloActivator extends Activator
 {
   public WorldHelloActivator (ReceptorSpecSet          receptors,
                               TransmitterSpecSet       transmitters,
                               LogicSubscriptionSpecSet subscriptions)
   {
     super("WorldHelloActivator",
           receptors,
           transmitters,
           subscriptions);
   }

   protected void evaluate ()
   {
     ...
   }
 }

 ReceptorSpecSet receptors = new ReceptorSpecSet();
 receptors.add("Hail", ReceptorMode.NON_BUFFERED, DateStimulus.TYPE_ID);

 TransmitterSpecSet transmitters = new TransmitterSpecSet();
 transmitters.add("Salutation", WorldHelloSalutation.TYPE_ID, StimulusTrace.ENABLED);

 LogicSubscriptionSpecSet subscriptions = new LogicSubscriptionSpecSet();
 subscriptions.add("HailInjector", "Hello", "Hail", "Request", TransactionFilter.DISABLED);

 Activator worldHelloActivator = new WorldHelloActivator(receptors,
                                                         transmitters,
                                                         subscriptions);

In a single expression: 

     public class WorldHelloActivator extends Activator
 {
   public WorldHelloActivator ()
   {
     super("WorldHelloActivator",
           new ReceptorSpec[] {
             new ReceptorSpec("Hail",
                              ReceptorMode.NON_BUFFERED,
                              DateStimulus.TYPE_ID)
           },
           new TransmitterSpec[] {
             new TransmitterSpec("Salutation",
                                 WorldHelloSalutation.TYPE_ID,
                                 StimulusTrace.ENABLED)
           },
           new LogicSubscriptionSpec[] {
             new LogicSubscriptionSpec("HailInjector",
                                       "Hello",
                                       "Hail",
                                       "Request",
                                       TransactionFilter.DISABLED)});
   }

   protected void evaluate ()
   {
     ...
   }
 }
 
 Activator worldHelloActivator = new WorldHelloActivator();

Note: Activators declared in Cell Definition files (see CellFactory) must use the single expression method and provide a zero-argument constructor. The activator class and constructor must be public.

See Also:
  • ReceptorSpec
  • TransmitterSpec
  • LogicSubscriptionSpec
  • LogicLoopbackSubscriptionSpec
  • LogicMapSubscriptionSpec

  • Constructor Details

    • Activator

      protected Activator(String name, ReceptorSpecSet receptors, TransmitterSpecSet transmitters, LogicSubscriptionSpecSet subscriptions)
      Allocates a new Activator object using specification sets.
      Parameters:
      name - This activator's name at runtime.
      receptors - The receptors this activator receives stimuli on.
      transmitters - The transmitters this activator emits stimuli on. If the transmitter set is empty (null or empty set), the activator does not emit stimuli.
      subscriptions - The subscriptions this activator advertises.

    • Activator

      protected Activator(String name, ReceptorSpec[] receptors, TransmitterSpec[] transmitters, LogicSubscriptionSpec[] subscriptions)
      Allocates a new Activator object using specification arrays.
      Parameters:
      name - This activator's name at runtime.
      receptors - The receptors this activator receives stimuli on.
      transmitters - The transmitters this activator emits stimuli on. If the transmitter array is empty (null or empty array), the activator does not emit stimuli.
      subscriptions - The subscriptions this activator advertises.

    • Activator

      protected Activator(String name, PropertySet properties, ReceptorSpecSet receptors, TransmitterSpecSet transmitters, LogicSubscriptionSpecSet subscriptions)
      Allocates a new Activator object using specification sets and includes properties.
      Parameters:
      name - This activator's name at runtime.
      properties - A dictionary of named properties.
      receptors - The receptors this activator receives stimuli on.
      transmitters - The transmitters this activator emits stimuli on. If the transmitter set is empty (null or empty set), the activator does not emit stimuli.
      subscriptions - The subscriptions this activator advertises.

    • Activator

      transmitters - The transmitters this activator emits stimuli on. If the transmitter array is empty (null or empty array), the activator does not emit stimuli.
      subscriptions - The subscriptions this activator advertises.

      Returns an activator property.
      Parameters:
      name - The property's name.
      Returns:
      The property's value.

    • start

      protected void start()
      Starts stimuli processing. Override this method to initialize the activator prior to processing.

    • evaluate

      protected abstract void evaluate()
      Evaluates stimuli once all receptors contain stimuli. Must be implemented in a specialized class.

    • stop

      protected void stop()
      Terminates stimuli processing. Override this method to clean up after processing terminates.

    • getStimulus

      protected final <T extends Stimulus> T getStimulus(String receptorName)
      Retrieves the stimulus from the specified receptor.
      Type Parameters:
      T - A stimulus type derived from Stimulus.
      Parameters:
      receptorName - The receptor from which to retrieve the stimulus.
      Returns:
      The stimulus.

    • setStimulus

      protected final void setStimulus(String transmitterName, Stimulus stimulus, UUID transactionID)
      Places the stimulus on the specified transmitter. A transmitter may emit multiple stimuli during an evaluation.
      Parameters:
      transmitterName - The transmitter over which to transmit the stimulus.
      stimulus - The stimulus.
      transactionID - The transaction with which to associate the stimulus. A null value indicates the stimulus is not part of a transaction.

    • setStimulus

      protected final void setStimulus(String transmitterName, Stimulus stimulus)
      Places the stimulus on the specified transmitter. The stimulus will not be associated with a transaction. A transmitter may emit multiple stimuli during an evaluation.
      Parameters:
      transmitterName - The transmitter over which to transmit the stimulus.
      stimulus - The stimulus.

    • createTransaction

      protected final UUID createTransaction(UUID stimulusID, UUID responseTransactionID)
      Creates a new transaction and optionally associates a response transaction.
      Parameters:
      stimulusID - The instance ID of the stimulus that triggered/initiated the new transaction.
      responseTransactionID - The transaction ID to be used when emitting a response stimulus. A null value indicates there is no response transaction.
      Returns:
      The new transaction ID.

    • createTransaction

      protected final UUID createTransaction(UUID stimulusID)
      Creates a new transaction without a response transaction.
      Parameters:
      stimulusID - The instance ID of the stimulus that triggered/initiated the new transaction.
      Returns:
      The new transaction ID.

    • terminateTransaction

      protected final void terminateTransaction(UUID transactionID)
      Releases resources associated with a transaction. Use this method after all response stimuli have been sent.
      Parameters:
      transactionID - The transaction to terminate.

    • isTransactionOriginator

      protected final boolean isTransactionOriginator(UUID transactionID)
      Indicates if this activator's cell was the originator of the specified transaction.
      Parameters:
      transactionID - The transaction to query. Specifying null is not considered an error, but true will be returned.
      Returns:
      true if this activator or another activator in the same cell started the transaction, false otherwise.

    • getResponseTransactionID

      protected final UUID getResponseTransactionID(UUID transactionID)
      Retrieves the response transaction ID for the specified transaction.

      The isTransactionOriginator, getResponseTransactionID and terminateTransaction methods are designed to work in mainline code whether or not transactions are being used.

      For example, the following code would work even if no transactions were in use: 

         DateStimulus d = getStimulus("Date");
 
   UUID transID = d.getTransactionID();
 
   if (isTransactionOriginator(transID)
   {
     setStimulus("SystemDate", getResponseTransactionID(transID);
   }

      In this example, d.getTransactionID() would return null, prompting isTransactionOriginator(transID) to return true. Finally, the setStimulus call would provide null for the transaction ID (because providing null to getResponseTransactionID always returns null), which is semantically the same as not providing a transaction ID at all.

      Parameters:
      transactionID - The transaction to query. Specifying null is not considered an error, but null will be returned.
      Returns:
      The response transaction ID or null if no response transaction is associated.

    • setTransactionHistoryWindow

      protected void setTransactionHistoryWindow(long millisecs)
      Sets the transaction history window duration.

      The default is 60000 milliseconds (1 minute.) The minimum is 250 milliseconds. Values less than the minimum will be automatically changed to the minimum value.

      Parameters:
      millisecs - The window of time maintained in the transaction history.

    • logEvent

      protected final void logEvent(EventType type, String details)
      Logs an event with details.
      Parameters:
      type - The event type.
      details - The event's details.

      details - The event's details.
      cause - The exception details to be reported.
